part.line: I need to find my ride.
part.narration: Yuki searches the terminal. The kind in an airport. A man holds up a sign with Yuki's name in Kanji. Yuki walks past it several times. Don't pop-up a vision tooltip here.The man stares at her each time. He flips the sign, rewrites the sign in Katakana, and holds it up. The vision text appears.
The clamor of cellphones, announcer-ettes, and distant jets resonates through the terminal. Two other guys are standing near davis.
part.line: Anyway, these are my bros from the American branch:
But enough formalities — let's get to the hotel.
part.narration: The friends ride through LA in a car, European.
part.line: Well, no-one can afford Gundams anymore. Everyone is broke.
It must be nice, huh? Less bank, more world.
Yeah, around here it's like, where's the love?
part.narration: The friends and Yuki are in a hotel room.
part.line: It works, even if it isn't a high rise in Tokyo.
Nor is it cozy and personal like those hostels in Amsterdam.
part.narration: Hoffman is signing Yuki's hotel form for her, in pencil. The tip breaks.
part.line: Damn. I hear they use better wood for pencils in Vilnius.
part.narration: Yuki looks at the Americans. She scratches her head.

It's hard to hear the crickets at night in Los Angeles. The room is pretty cozy. There is a small lamp on the night stand next to the one-woman bed. Well, we should leave the little lady to get some rest. After all, she has hundreds of demos to play tomorrow. And, at this E3, She's Sega's sole representative. What? Knock 'em dead! Everyone leaves.Camera slowly close up on Yuki's face.The wind blows harder and harder. The cars honk louder. The crickets' chirps pierce the sound barrier and a camera flashes.Sudden shift. August 17. Los Angeles Convention Center.Cut to further away from Yuki.
